Sir Bradley Wiggins has QUIT The Jump after breaking his leg in smash on reality show 
The show has claimed another victim after Wiggo was injured filming the fourth show Exclusive by DAN SALES and ANDY HALLS 12th February 2017, 10:33 pm Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments SIR BRADLEY WIGGINS has been forced to quit skiing telly hit The Jump ‚Äì after breaking his leg in a nasty smash. 
The Olympics and Tour De France hero, 36, hurt himself filming the yet to be broadcast fourth show. 5 Cycling champ Brad pictured in Austria before he became the latest celeb to be hurt on the show 
Wiggo ‚Äì knighted by the Queen in 2013 ‚Äì had already injured himself racing against comedian Mark Dolan in the first week. 
Doctors said he had suffered a torn calf muscle but he vowed to continue in the Channel Four contest after being given painkillers. 
But the sporting legend, who retired from professional cycling in December, then broke his left leg doing intense snow cross training. Splash News 5 Bradley was injured during the fourth show 
He flew back to England over the weekend and saw a specialist who told him had to be kept off his feet for up to six weeks. 
A source said: ‚ÄúHe doesn‚Äôt need an operation, but he does need to rest and that‚Äôs why he couldn‚Äôt carry on competing. 
‚ÄúHe hurt himself in snow cross training, where they wear boots, it‚Äôs a cross between ice skating and skiing, it‚Äôs like an obstacle course. PA:Press Association Wiggo will still appear in the four episodes that he‚Äôs filmed Bradley Wiggins injures leg in training on The Jump forcing him to sit out Gutted to be leaving The Jump. I wanted to give you an injury update...

‚ÄúFrom everything we know the break should heal properly. It is a small fracture so much so that he had been hoping to be able to carry on from it. 
"But the specialist he needed to keep off it. He is really disappointed not to be able to carry on and he would have done if there had been any chance to compete.‚Äù 1/2 Seen a specialist, I have a small leg fracture & need to rest for 3/6 weeks. Good news no surgery or cast required. 
‚Äî Brad Wiggins (@SirWiggo) February 12, 2017 2/2 Huge thanks to the crew & good luck to all of the cast. Due to the way the show is filmed I'll still be on until show 4, so tune in üëçüèª 
‚Äî Brad Wiggins (@SirWiggo) February 12, 2017 
The cyclist did not have to have an operation or need to use crutches but has been told to keep off it for three to six weeks.
